page.title: 19THE WEST SOMERSET RAILWAY
page.content:
THhe West Somerset Railway runs across the north-eastern corner of the block. The line passes close to the village of Combe Florey.
The railway is a privately owned company, open during the summer months, linking Bishops Lydeard to Minehead. It was hoped to extend the service to Taunton but difficulties have arisen in linking the line up to the existing BR service in the County town. At present, the line starts at the Norton Fitzwarren junction west of Taunto and runs through Bishops Lydeard, Crowcombe, Stogumber, Williton, Watchet,Washford and Dunster. The line terminates at Minehead.
